intro: Debregeasia salicifolia, commonly known as the willow-leaf kewia, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its slender, willow-like leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in mountainous regions. It has a compact growth habit and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
